title: Extremely ...
description: Extremely fiddly and lots of and then this kind of rules about the different things you can do.  I'm told it scales very well though and I'd be in to playing this more in the future.  But it really didn't grab me as something I need to play very much going forward if the opportunity doesn't present itself.

title: After 11 p...
description: After 11 plays I really love this game but I have started to see the limit of it.  Looking forward to the first big expansion.

title: Love the g...
description: Love the game. So many actions to do, and love the brain teasing puzzle aspect of it on how to minimize your negative score while at the same time ensuring the maximization of your production!

title: Rosenberg,...
description: Rosenberg, so worth checking out. Takes rather long though. Rating based on first solo game which was a lot of fun. Do hope to get this one to the table sometime.

title: I adore this game!
description: the best Uwe has ever created.  So deep, with so many ways to play and win.

title: So it's th...
description: So it's the latest Uwe Rosenberg medium-heavy worker-placement game. The spatial stuff, which I thought would irk me, is just fine. Getting additional boards, and managing them, is what I find really cool.

title: Very open-...
description:
Very open-ended Euro. I am starting to see how different strategies work, but I'm still not good at it. I also still need to try the expansion.

On paper, I this game is just as interesting as all the great Euros I like. But emotionally, for whatever reason, I can't get excited about this game. It just feels... fine.
